examples: She has composed several poems to read aloud to the class.

images.alt: Photo of a person at a piano, writing on paper.
images.description: A person sits at a piano. Sheets of paper lean on a stand at the top of the piano. With one hand, the person writes on one of the sheets of paper. His other hand is on the piano keys.
images.caption: A musician composes a song.

examples: He was a professional attorney after finishing law school.

images.alt: Photo of a doctor talking with a patient.
images.description: A doctor is at a table with another person. The doctor wears a white coat and has a stethescope around her neck. She holds a clipboard in her hand. The doctor points to something on the clipboard while she looks at the other person. The other person looks at the clipboard, too.
images.caption: Doctors go through years of training to become professionals.

meanings.definition: A tool, musical, or mechanical device used for special work.
examples: The musician plays several different instruments.

images.alt: Photo of a person playing a saxophone
images.description: A person playing a musical instrument called the saxophone. The saxophone is long, curved. It has a mouthpiece at its narrow upper end, and it opens up to a wide bell shape at its lower end. The saxophone is made of gold colored metal called brass. You can see many keys down the front of the saxophone.
images.caption: A saxophone is just one type of musical instrument

meanings.definition: To give an order giving permission to perform a certain task.
examples: The author was commissioned to write a biography of the film star.

meanings.definition: Employment, or a period or post of employment, especially in the performing arts
examples: The band had three engagements in three different cities over the next week.

meanings.definition: In or to a country that is not one's own.
examples: The Americans were travelling abroad to England and France.

meanings.definition: The work a person chooses to do through life.
examples: She wants to have a career as a scientist.

images.alt: Photo of two people working in a lab.
images.description: Two people wearing lab goggles and lab coats. They are working with scientific materials.
images.caption: Science is just one field to go into. Music, art, and teacher are other options.

meanings.definition: Known by many people; easily recognized.
examples: The song was so familiar, the audience could sing along with the band.
She referred to his work in her speech.

meanings.definition: Any activity that takes great effort or planning.
examples: The building project will take five years to complete.

images.alt: Photo of people working on a building.
images.description: People working on a garage. Ladders lean against the front of the garage. Someone stands on a ladder at the side of the garage, working near the roof. People in front of the garage are cutting wood.
images.caption: Multiple people are working on the garage, showing that it's not a small project!

meanings.definition: In or to a country that is not one's own.
examples: The Americans were travelling overseas to England and France.

meanings.definition: The work a person chooses to do through life.
examples: She wants to pursue science as her vocation.

images.description: Two people wearing lab goggles and lab coats. They are working with scientific materials.
images.caption: Science is just one field to go into. Music, art, and teacher are other options.

examples: The song was so well renowned, the audience could sing along with the band.
She cited his work in her speech.

examples: The business enterprise will take five years to get completely started.
